name: An Interview with Guido van Rossum
description: - Python creator discusses features and future of the language. O'Reilly Media.

name: Charming Python
description: - Column by David Mertz, Gnosis Software, Inc. Over 20 articles on Python programming, many topics.

name: Developing GNOME Application with Python
description: - Set of articles written for beginners in Gnome programming and GNU/Linux.

name: Generating Dynamic Documents from Template with Python
description: - Description and usage of a ready-to-use templating system.

name: Mark Lutz's Python Advocacy Page
description: - Links to several old Python articles and reviews.

name: Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs)
description: - Design documents providing information to the Python community, or describing a new feature for Python.

name: Python Programming Language
description: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

name: Python Squeezes the Web
description: - A practical example of using Python to automate the crawl of web pages.

name: SOA and Web Services
description: - Several articles related to the development of web services with Python, written by Mike Olson and Uche Ogbuji, 2001-2004. IBM developerWorks.

name: Why I Promote Python
description: - Passionate advocacy piece. Author dreams of a world where programs are written in a language that can be taught in primary school.

name: Interview of Guido van Rossum
description:
- Interview of the BDFL by the visitors of a French Linux news portal (the English version is included).
                     (March 12, 2003)

name: A Conversation with Guido van Rossum
description:
- Python creator talks with Bill Venners about topics relevant to Python and its community; 6 part series, Artima Software.
                     (February 17, 2003)

name: Guide to Python Introspection
description:
- How to spy on your Python objects.
                     (December 01, 2002)

name: Proper XML Output in Python
description:
- Uche Ogbuji explores the intricacies of creating proper XML output in Python, including character set and encoding issues.
                     (November 13, 2002)

name: Python Persistence Management
description:
- Using serialization to store Python objects.
                     (November 01, 2002)

name: A Tour of 4Suite
description:
- In this installment of Python and XML, Uche Ogbuji provides a tour of the core XML processing facilities of 4Suite.
                     (October 16, 2002)

name: Make Python Run as Fast as C with Psyco
description:
- Using psyco, the python specializing compiler.
                     (October 01, 2002)

name: Simplified Exception Identification in Python
description:
- Using functions and exception pattern dictionaries to simplify error recovery.
                     (July 28, 2002)

name: Pick Up Some Python with This Script Walk-through
description:
- An example conversion of a Perl script to Python.
                     (June 18, 2002)

name: Space Shuttle Engineers Use Python to Streamline Mission Design
description:
- Description of a practical use of Python by NASA, with quotes of Robin Friedrich, USA's Senior Project Engineer.
                     (June 17, 2002)

name: Algorithms with Python
description: - アルゴリズムとデータ構造の実装と解説。

name: Altis, Kevin
description: - News and information related to Python and its promotion as "most powerful language you can still read."

name: Anand Pillai -  Random bytes on technology and open source
Python: Yes, You Should Be Using It!
description:
- Alex Martelli gives an overview of the possibilities offered by Python, along with samples allowing the newcomer to experience Python code.  [Free registration required to view this article.]
                     (April 01, 2002)

name: Using Mix-ins with Python
description:
- An explanation of the mix-in programming style as applied in Python.
                     (April 01, 2001)

name: Why Python?
description:
- Article by Eric Raymond where he explains reasons that led him to switch from Perl to Python.
                     (May 01, 2000)

name: Effective Python
description: - ライブラリ リファレンスから一歩踏み込んだPythonプログラミングの解説。

name: LispプログラマのためのPython入門
description: - LispプログラマがPythonを学ぶときのための要点がまとめられている。

name: Blended Technologies
description: - Programming weblog for a small, newly formed, and curious company; covers mostly Python.

name: Gruet, Richard
description: - Python Language Quick Reference versions 1.5 to 2.3. OmniORBpy utilities and other Python stuff.

name: Hinsen, Konrad
description: - Python for science. In particular computational chemistry.

name: Free Python and Zope Hosting Directory
description: - A directory of free Python and Zope hosting providers, with reviews and ratings.

name: Embedding Python in Multi-Threaded C/C++ Applications
description:
- A Linux Magazine article featuring an overview of the C/C++ API, explaining how to extend and embed Python in a multi-thread context.
                     (May 01, 2000)

name: Linux Journal Python Interview
description:
- An Interview with Guido van Rossum. A conversation with the creator of Python about an effort to teach Python to non-computer science students.
                     (September 28, 1999)

name: On Python
description: - wxPython、xyzzyからpydocを使う方法などの解説。

name: Python
description: - 愛知大学の学生用に書かれたテキスト。グラフィックスやGUI処理を扱っている。

name: Python CGIプログラミング入門
description: - CGIで頻繁に利用されるプログラム処理を解説。

name: Python with Hardware
description: - フィジカルコンピューティングのユーザグループ。

name: Kuchling, A.M.
description: - Lots of Python code and information, several quotation collections, and a Robertson Davies page.

name: Learning Python
description: - A weblog tracking one man's journey into Python.

name: Das deutsche Python-Forum
description: - Diskussionsforen für Python-Programmierer zur gegenseitigen Hilfe und Beantwortung von Fragen.

name: Alex Martelli: phyton
description: - Propone articoli e presentazioni del programmatore.

name: Html.it: Guida a Python
description: - Guida introduttiva alla sintassi e all'uso pratico del linguaggio.

name: Imparare a Programmare
description: - Traduzione del tutorial introduttivo alla programmazione "Learning to Program" di Alan Gauld.

name: O'Reilly Python Center
description: - Features Python books, resources, news and articles.

name: Python Developer's Guide
description: - Resources for reporting bugs, accessing the Python source tree with CVS and taking part in the development of Python.

name: Social Bug
description: - Scripts, examples and news about Python programming for the Windows platform.

name: eff-bot's Daily Python URL
description: - Contains links to assorted resources from the Python universe, compiled by PythonWare.

name: An Introduction to Python
description: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161769. Printed edition of official tutorial, for v2.x, from Python.org. [Network Theory, online]

name: PythonMatrixJp
description: - Tips集をはじめ、ハードウェア、GUIなどのプログラミングを解説。

name: Pythonおもちゃばこ
description: - ユーティリティやライブラリを配布。

name: Lundh, Fredrik
description: - Personal guide to libraries, modules and extensions. Includes a weblog with Python news and personal ramblings.

name: Norlanders, Oscar
description: - Blog about programming. TeX bibliography tweak. Resume. Links.

name: Williamson, Mark
description: - Collection of mostly music related Python and PD open source projects.

name: van Rossum, Guido
description: - Personal home page of the creator of the Python programming language.

name: Die Programmiersprache Python - ein Überblick
description: - Text eines Vortrages zur Vorstellung der Programmiersprache.

name: Die Skriptsprache Python im Vergleich
description: - Ein systematischer Vergleich von Python mit Perl und Tcl.

name: Jython in Deutsch
description: - Deutschsprachige Ressourcen zur Programmiersprache Jython. Mit Tutorials, Blog und Forum.

name: Marco Barisione
description: - Materiale vario su Python fra cui la traduzione del "Non-Programmers Tutorial For Python" di Josh Cogliati in vari formati.

name: Python Italia
description: - Dedicato a questo linguaggio, contiene documentazione, guide, suggerimenti, novità e link correlati.

name: Tutorial Python
description: - L'autore Michele Sciabarrà propone un corso per l'apprendimento della programmazione in questo linguaggio Open Source.

name: Un giorno alle prese con IDLE
Association francophone python (AFPY)
description: - Association pour la promotion du langage. Propose ses actualités et des offres d'emploi.

name: Core Python Programming
description: - By Wesley J. Chun; Prentice Hall PTR, 2001, ISBN 0130260363. For experienced developers to improve extant skills; professional level examples. Starts by introducing syntax, objects, error handling, functions, classes, built-ins. [Prentice Hall]

name: Pythonドキュメント翻訳プロジェクト
description: - Python Library Referenceなどを扱う。概要、進行状況、関連リンク集、メーリングリスト。

name: Lieben Sie Python?
description: - Eine detaillierte Beschreibung der Sprache, im Vergleich mit anderen Programmiersprachen, und mit anschaulichen Beispielen.

name: Perl und Python
description: - Text zu einem Vortrag, welcher die Eigenschaften der beiden Scriptsprachen miteinander vergleicht.

name: Python Academy UG (haftungsbeschränkt) & Co. KG
description: - Das Unternehmen ist auf Pythonschulungen und damit verbundene Beratungsleistungen spezialisiert. Neben Seminaren für Programmieranfänger und Schulungen für Programmierer gibt es Module für Spezialthemen, die als Firmenkurse kombiniert werden können. Weiterhin sind Kurse für Wissenschaftler und Ingenieure im Programm. [D-04158 Leipzig]

name: Python Developer
description: - Ein Weblog von Matthias Süß mit Code-Schnippseln aus den Themenbereichen Netzwerkprogrammierung und Textverarbeitung mit Python.

name: Django book
description: - Propose une traduction d'un livre introduisant au développement web en Python avec Django.

name: Django-fr
description: - Framework pour le développement d'applications web. Propose une documentation et des tutoriels pour commencer à développer.

name: Développer des Applications Gnome avec Python
description: - Série d'articles destinée aux débutants en programmation Gnome et GNU/Linux.

name: Plongez au coeur de Python
description: - Tutoriel libre destiné aux programmeurs expérimentés.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Python
description:
- The primary goal of this book is to promote object-oriented design using Python and to illustrate the use of the emerging object-oriented design patterns.
A secondary goal of the book is to present mathematical tools just in time. Analysis techniques and proofs are presented as needed and in the proper context.

name: Pythonハンディマニュアル
description: - Pythonの紹介や構文等の要約を掲載している。

name: Python単体テスト用フレームワーク
description: - PyUnitの解説の日本語訳。概要、使用方法と利用条件、将来の計画。

name: Python Netzwerk Deutschland
description: - Eine Mailing-Liste, welche als Kontaktstelle dient zwischen  Firmen und IT-Spezialisten mit Python-Erfahrung.

name: Python, Eine objektorientierte Scriptsprache für GUIs
description: - Eine Studienarbeit zur Demonstration der Möglichkeiten von Python zur Entwicklung grafischer Oberflächen.

name: Pythonmania
description: - Im Blog werden Artikel, Tutorials, Links, Buchrezensionen und Neuigkeiten gesammelt.

name: Programmation python
description: - Blog, portions de code, tutoriels et bibliothèque.

name: Python facile
description: - Ressources (liens) en français, exemples de modules, classes et scripts.

name: Ressources Python
description: - Présente le livre « Apprendre à programmer avec Python » écrit par Gérard Swinnen, offre également une version librement redistribuable en téléchargement et un recueil de liens utiles.

name: 中蟒 中文 Python 編程語言網站
description: - 中蟒是 Python 語言的中文版本. 提供即譯式, 互動, 以概念出發並可擴展的程式語言.

name: Dive Into Python 3
description: - By Mark Pilgrim, Guide to Python 3  and its differences from Python 2. Each chapter starts with a real code sample and explains it fully. Has a comprehensive appendix of all the syntactic and semantic changes in Python 3

name: Foundations of Python Network Programming
description: - This book covers a wide range of topics. From raw TCP and UDP to encryption with TSL, and then to HTTP, SMTP, POP, IMAP, and ssh. It gives you a good understanding of each field and how to do everything on the network with Python.

name: djangoproject.jp
description: - Djangoの日本におけるユーザー・コミュニティ。メーリングリスト、ドキュメントの和訳。

name: python-kconv
description: - 日本語文字コード変換ライブラリの開発、配布。

name: VPython
description: - Fournit une référence à cette version du langage couplée d'un module graphique 3D.

name: FreeTechBooks: Python Scripting Language
description: - Annotated list of free online books on Python scripting language. Topics range from beginner to advanced.

name: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Learning with Python
description: - By Allen B. Downey, Jeffrey Elkner, Chris Meyers; Green Tea Press, 2002, ISBN 0971677506. Teaches general principles of programming, via Python as subject language. Thorough, in-depth approach to many basic and intermediate programming topics. Full text online and downloads: HTML, PDF, PS, LaTeX. [Free, Green Tea Press]

name: Learn to Program Using Python
description: - Book by Alan Gauld with full text online. Introduction for those learning programming basics: terminology, concepts, methods to write code. Assumes no prior knowledge but basic computer skills.

name: 日本Pythonユーザ会
description: - ニュース、言語の紹介、チュートリアル。

name: Making Use of Python
description: - By Rashi Gupta; John Wiley and Sons, 2002, ISBN 0471219754. Covers language basics, use for CGI scripting, GUI development, network programming; shows why it is one of more sophisticated of popular scripting languages. [Wiley]

name: Practical Python
description: - By Magnus Lie Hetland; Apress LP, 2002, ISBN 1590590066. Readable guide to ideas most vital to new users, from basics common to high level languages, to more specific aspects, to a series of 10 ever more complex programs. [Apress]

name: Pro Python System Administration
description: - By Rytis Sileika, ISBN13: 978-1-4302-2605-5,  Uses real-world system administration examples like manage devices with SNMP and SOAP, build a distributed monitoring system, manage web applications and parse complex log files, monitor and manage MySQL databases.

name: Programming in Python 3 (Second Edition)
description: - A Complete Introduction to the Python 3.

name: 言語処理系演習資料
description: - mini-Pythonの処理系を構築する東京大学電気系Bの講義の資料。

name: Python 2.1 Bible
description: - By Dave Brueck, Stephen Tanner; John Wiley and Sons, 2001, ISBN 0764548077. Full coverage, clear explanations, hands-on examples, full language reference; shows step by step how to use components, assemble them, form full-featured programs. [John Wiley and Sons]

name: Python 3 Object Oriented Programming
description: - A step-by-step tutorial for OOP in Python 3, including discussion and examples of abstraction, encapsulation, information hiding, and raise, handle, define, and manipulate exceptions.

name: Python Language Reference Manual
description: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161785. Printed edition of official language reference, for v2.x, from Python.org, describes syntax, built-in datatypes. [Network Theory, online]

name: Python Programming Patterns
description: - By Thomas W. Christopher; Prentice Hall PTR, 2002, ISBN 0130409561. Shows how to write large programs, introduces powerful design patterns that deliver high levels of robustness, scalability, reuse.

name: Python Programming with the Java Class Libraries: A Tutorial for Building Web and Enterprise Applications with Jython
description: - By Richard Hightower; Addison-Wesley, 2002, 0201616165. Begins with Python basics, many exercises, interactive sessions. Shows programming novices concepts and practical methods. Shows programming experts Python's abilities and ways to interface with Java APIs. [publisher website]

name: Python: Visual QuickStart Guide
description: - By Chris Fehily; Peachpit Press, 2002, ISBN 0201748843. Task-based, step-by-step visual reference guide, many screen shots, for courses in digital graphics; Web design, scripting, development; multimedia, page layout, office tools, operating systems. [Prentice Hall]

name: Sams Teach Yourself Python in 24 Hours
description: - By Ivan Van Laningham; Sams Publishing, 2000, ISBN 0672317354. Split into 24 hands-on, 1 hour lessons; steps needed to learn topic: syntax, language features, OO design and programming, GUIs (Tkinter), system administration, CGI. [Sams Publishing]

name: An Object Model for Multiparadigm Programming
Concepts and Architecture of Vista: A Multiparadigm Programming Environment
description: - Visual multiparadigm programming: visual + object-oriented (signal flow + data flow); from Proceedings of 10th IEEE/CS Symposium on Visual Languages, St. Louis, USA, 4-7 October 1994. Downloads: HTML, PS.

name: ELAN
description: - Created 1974 by Technical University of Berlin group, as alternative to BASIC in teaching, for systematic programming, and related styles: top-down, bottom-up, recursive, modular, syntax-directed. Descriptions, brief resource list, documents. English, Deutsch.

name: Heron
description: - Home site. Has brief description, specification, tutorial, related articles, download.

name: Nova
description: - High-level, general purpose, pure object-oriented language; platform independent, strong-typed, garbage collected, very small Run-Time Environment (RTE) runs programs directly from source code, live code can be distributed-shared across networks as easily as HTML.

name: Text Processing in Python
description: - By David Mertz; Addison Wesley. Book in progress, full text, ASCII format. Asks for feedback. [author website, Gnosis Software, Inc.]

name: XML Processing with Python
description: - By Sean McGrath; Prentice Hall PTR, 2000, ISBN 0130211192, has CD-ROM. Methods to build XML applications fast, Python tutorial, DOM and SAX, new Pyxie open source XML processing library. [Prentice Hall PTR]

name: Heron-Centric: Ruminations of a Language Designer
description: - Weblog on language design issues, software development techniques, news, on Heron language, and similar languages like Java, C++.

name: Kx Systems, Inc.
description: - Makes K, advanced vector oriented, functional language, one of the fastest application development environments (according to Bell Laboratories Benchmarking), and allows very fast processing of large datasets.

name: Lfyre
description: - General purpose, compiled; high performance, expressiveness, flexibility. Many features found in other languages, and extra features: creating new operators, keywords, programming paradigms. News, download. [SourceForge]

name: Lightweight Languages as Software Engineering Tools
description: - Usenix Paper discussing multiparadigm programming as part of a larger topic.

name: Multiparadigm Programming Group
description: - At Leibniz Laboratory, Grenoble, France; research topics, news, publications, members. [English and French]

name: Multiparadigm Programming Language
description: - Brief description, language list sorted by count and supported paradigms. [Wikipedia]

name: Needle
description: - Pure object-oriented, functional language, statically typed, garbage collected; mixes ideas from Dylan, Lisp, Scheme; ML; Cecil, Smalltalk; description, slide show, downloads, links. [Open Source, MIT]

name: Nial Systems Ltd.
description: - NIAL, Nested Interactive Array Language, mixes aspects of functional array and procedural languages. Rich primitives set makes it easy, fast to code loop-free data-driven algorithms. Also Q'Nial IDE, and Nial Data Engine embeddable interpreter. [Open Source, Artistic Licence]

name: Piccola: A Small Composition Language
description: - PI based COmposition LAnguage: research language to explore the paradigm: Application = Components + Scripts. From the University of Berne.

name: ResearchIndex: From Competition to Amalgamation of Different Programming Paradigms
description: - Describes basic elements (data, actions, tunings, voids, mixtures, ...) and principles of programming (stratification, implicit knowledge, limited freedom, ...), directed to amalgamating different programming paradigms (imperative, object-oriented, functional, constraint, ...) in a unified process of generating computer system models.

name: Scala
description: - General purpose language; multiparadigm (object-oriented, functional, concurrent elements); statically typed, type-safe; focus: Web services. Successor of Funnel. Interoperates with Java VM or .NET, XML aware. [Open source, BSD-like license]

name: X Language: xlang
description: - The eXtensible Language: easy to use, multi-syntax, portable set of APIs to create CLI and GUI applications for Unix/X11 and Win32; will ease making big applications, has interpreter/compiler/debugger. [Open Source, GPL]

name: XLR: Extensible Language and Runtime
description: - XL is designed to implement the ideas of Concept Programming. It can apply to many domains and problem spaces, not only a small subset of the problems users must solve.

name: Heron: Introducing The Heron Programming Language
Django Türkiye
description: - Django ve Python dersleri, videolar ve makeleler yer alıyor.

name: PythonTR.org
description: - Python dili hakkında eğitim videoları, kod bankası, örnek kod ve problem çözümleri hakkında derslerin yer aldığı, gönüllü çalışmaları ile desteklenen Python Django ağırlıklı topluluk çalışmaları.

name: istihza.com
description: - Python programlama dili ve bu dilin resmi arayüz takımı olan Tkinter'e ilişkin eğitici bilgiler verilmektedir.

name: Anvil
description: - Dynamically compiled, object-oriented language and environment, especially suited for web applications.

name: Avail
description: - Multiply-polymorphic modular language with highly flexible syntax. Unique inheritance model allows multiple inheritance and polymorphism, constrained genericity, covariant attributes via immutability. Due to identityless nature of types, a type can have an infinite number of super- and sub-types.

name: Class (Computer Science)
description: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

name: CodeSimian
description: - Interpreted, with 1 type (all is data) only, made with Java; can be used as strings of its own code or as Java objects, code (even 1-line program) can write or modify other code; main purpose: write artificial intelligences that modify (parts of) themselves or write other code.

name: Dynace
description: - Object-oriented extension to C language. Solves many of the problems associated with C++.

name: JellyJ
description: - Project to create object-oriented language that is easy to learn for beginners.

name: Kapsel
description: - Experimental object-oriented language. Looks and feels much like original Smalltalk, adds features to specify access to object detail.

name: Lava
description: - Experimental, innovative, object-oriented, interpreted language, and programming environment LavaPE; edits programs via syntax-sensitive point-and-click style structure editors, not text editors; parameterized (virtual) types, refactoring,  static checks.

name: ISE Technology paper: Agents, Iterators and Introspection in Eiffel
description: - Written in the form of an addition to the book 'Eiffel: The Language'. Introspection is Eiffel's term for reflection. Acrobat PDF format.

name: Object-Oriented Concurrent Reflective Languages can be Implemented Efficiently
Reflection '96 Conference
description: - Proceedings, electronic copies of abstracts and full documents. Much useful information.

name: Reflection in Logic, Functional and Object-Priented Programming: A Short Comparative Study
description: - Research paper; Department of Data Processing and Operations Research, University of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. ResearchIndex.

name: ActiveState Programmer Network: ASPN
description: - Online resource for open source community: information and resources for Perl, PHP, Python, Tcl, XSLT; Cookbooks, documents, mail lists, modules, news feeds, products, user groups, Web services.

name: Nice
description: - OO language based on, integrated with, Java (compiler emits Java bytecode); features of functional programming, implements state-of-art results from academic research, for more expressivity, modularity, safety. [Open source, GPL]

name: Noobeed
description: - Interactive geomatic object-oriented language for spatial modeling, image processing, remote sensing, digital photogrammetry, geographic information system (GIS), geodesy, and surveying and mapping.

name: Open Source High-level Languages in Your Neighborhood
description:
- Treats 6 popular, modern, high-level languages (Eiffel, Lua, Smalltalk, Squeak, Python, Ruby), what they are being used for, where they are hiding in industry today. Descriptions, resource links. [Developer.com]
                     (February 10, 2003)

name: Nosica
description: - Syntax similar to C++, Java, advanced high level features: strong type system, automatic memory management, global code optimization. Development website, has some documentation, forum, announcement from developers, sources. [Open source, GPL]

name: Qu
description: - Full-featured, semi-dynamic object-oriented language. [Open source, GPL]

name: Superx++
description: - Compiled object-oriented language fully based on XML syntax; conforms to XML version 1.0 specification as published by W3C. Descriptions, documents, FAQ, downloads, links. [Open Source, LGPL]

name: UnrealScript Language Reference
description: - High level, simple, Java-style, object-oriented, compile time error checking; native support for major concepts of time, state, properties, networking, which few languages address, to greatly simplify code. Mainly for games.

name: VIRT Laboratory
description: - Makes paxScript: general purpose, imperative, object-oriented language, with new technology of dynamic data structure processing; lets one process dynamic data structures (lists, trees, more) effectively with no pointers. Ensures laconic and uniform notation allows hiding memory allocation/deallocation mechanisms.

name: Základy programovacieho jazyka Python
description: - Tutorial od premenných cez zoznamy, tuple, komplexné čisla po OOP.

name: Documentación de Python
description: - Referencia, guía de programación, manual y documentación.

name: Inmersión en Python
description: - Wikilibro para el aprendizaje basado en una traducción del libro "Dive Into Python" de Mark Pilgrim.

name: bx
description: - Language with objects, interfaces, parameterized types, no inheritance, operator overloading, generators, static instantiation, compiled to C; descriptions, source code, examples, compiler.

name: merd
description: - Ruby-like expressiveness + static type checks, like Haskell. [Open Source, GPL]

name: merd: SourceForge
description: - Practical OO language: Ruby-like expressiveness with Haskell-like static type checks. Coded in ML, runs on Linux. [Open Source, GPL]

name: pythonmexico.org
description: - Punto de encuentro para los usuarios de México. Contiene documentación y lista de eventos.

name: DjangoBook
description: - Перевод книги о фреймворке Django, который используется для разработки веб-приложений. Примеры кода.

name: Python Community
description: - Портал для Python-программистов. Статьи и переводы. Каталог ссылок на тематические ресурсы. Форум.

name: Веб-мозги
description: - Блог о программирования на Python. Создание сайтов с помощью Django.

name: Язык программирования Python
description: - Сайт о языке программирования Python на русском языке: документация, статьи, ссылки, новости.

name: Biblioteka Riklaunima - Python
description: - Strona zawierająca kurs z podstaw Pythona, tworzenia aplikacji internetowych w Django/Pylons, interfejsów graficznych w pyQT4 oraz gier w pyGame.

name: Django
description: - Oficjalna polska strona dotycząca Django. Podstawy konfiguracji serwerów do pracy z Django, ćwiczenia dotyczące tworzenia aplikacji.

name: Django Book
description: - Polska wersja Djangobook, tłumaczona przez Rafała Jońcę.

name: Kurs języka Python
description: - Wykłady na temat Pythona autorstwa Marcina Młotkowskiego.

name: LWP: Lamerskie Wprowadzenie do Pythona
description: - Strona zawierająca obszerny kurs z podstaw Pythona poparty wieloma przykładami.

name: Zanurkuj w Pythonie
description: - Obszerny podręcznik programowania w Pythonie, zawierający opis języka i przykładowe programy.

name: 파이썬(Python) 정보광장
description: - 설치/소개/입문서   Documentation   FAQ(영문)   강의노트   인터넷 프로그래밍   웹개발 도구   GUI   DataBase   각종 모듈/패키지   S/W 개발 툴/방법   Win32   세미나 자료   프로젝트

name: Byte-code
description: - Definition with links to related topics. [FOLDOC, open content]

name: Bytecode
description: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia, open content, GNU FDL]

name: Parrotcode
description: - Home of Parrot Virtual Machine, made for dynamic languages, originally a target for Perl 6 compiler, hosts many language implementations in varied stages of completion: Tcl, Javascript, Ruby, Lua, Scheme, PHP, Python, Perl 6, APL, .NET. Open source.

name: Virtual Virtual Machine
description: - VVM overview, history, members, projects, realizations, publications.

name: 1% the Code
description: - Chuck Moore, father of Forth, says programs can be far smaller in colorForth than C. No code samples.

name: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
description: - Shows source code implementation for the same simple program across over 250 different programming languages.

name: A Comparative Overview of C#
description: - Also compares C#, Java, C++. By Ben Albahari.

name: A Comparison between 10 Languages
description: - Table compares 13 traits at top, 10 languages to side: BETA, C#, C++, C-Talk, Eiffel, Java, Object Pascal, Ruby, Sather, Smalltalk.

name: A Comparison between BETA, C++, Eiffel, Java, Object Pascal, Ruby and Smalltalk
description: - Table compares 12 traits to side, 7 languages at top.

name: Accumulator Generator
description: - Compares canonical solutions to same problem as code samples in: C++, Dylan, E, Erlang, Haskell, JavaScript, Lisp (Arc, Common, Goo, Scheme), Lua, Maple, Mathematica, Oz-Mozart, NewtonScript, Perl, Python, REBOL, Ruby, Smalltalk, VBScript. [Paul Graham]

name: Ada 95, Java, and C++
description: - Some think Java is like C++. Usual C++ idioms do not apply to Java as it is not a C++ superset or subset; Java is a derivation with many modifications, extensions. Both language syntax are alike, but semantics and philosophy are very different. Java is nearer Ada 95 than C++, except in syntax.

name: Ada, C, C++, and Java vs. The Steelman
description: - Compares 4 programming languages (Ada 95, C, C++, Java) with the needs of "Steelman", original 1978 requirements document for Ada language. Big detailed table.

name: An Empirical Comparison of C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Rexx, and Tcl for a Search/string-processing Program
description:
- One set of requirements, 80 implementations, coded by 74 different programmers in various languages, compared for properties: run time, memory use, source text length, comment density, program structure, reliability, effort needed.
                     [PDF]

name: C# from a Java Developer's Perspective
description: - Thorough article by Dare Obasanjo, treats most similarities and differences between the two languages: features in Java and not in C#, and features in C# and not in Java. Text, tables, code, resources.

name: C++??: A Critique of C++ (3rd ed.)
description:
- A critical view on the C++ and C programming language.
                     [PDF]

name: CLOS, Eiffel, and Sather: A Comparison
description: - References, zipped Postscript, and inlined gifs.

name: Python Documentation Index
description: - Official tutorial and references, including library/module usage, Macintosh libraries, language syntax, extending/embedding, and the Python/C API.  Also links to off-site beginners' tutorials, HOWTOs, and many special interest topics.

name: Comparisons of Tcl with Other Systems
description: - Many comparisons between Tcl/Tk and other similar systems, most copied from comp.lang.tcl.

name: D vs Other Languages
description: - Yes-No table with definitions compares D, C, C++, C#, Java, on: GC, functions, arrays, OOP, performance, reliability, compatibility, conditional compiling. [Digital Mars]

name: Eiffel and Delphi Compared
description: - Text compares differences of several main aspects.

name: Examples of Programs in Different Programming Languages
description: - Compares 129 (or 157?) languages, via 418 code samples, and growing.

name: Forth Versus C
description: - Pro-Forth question and answer text, some questions have several answers.

name: A Beginner's Python Tutorial
description: - A Python tutorial originally written for the modding community of Firaxis' Civilization. Useful to beginners with little or no programming knowledge.

name: BayPIGgies
description: - The Silicon Valley-San Francisco Bay Area Python Users Group.

name: mail.python.org Mailing Lists
description: - The public mailing lists hosted on mail.python.org.

name: Forth and Not C
description: - Pro-Forth text explains why C is used more than Forth.

name: Four-fold Increase in Productivity and Quality
description:
- Published internal study, of Ericsson AXD 301 ATM switch project, using Erlang, C, C++, Java. Results: programmer productivity, code error rates, roughly proportional to source code size.
                     [PDF]

name: Guidelines for Choosing a Computer Language: Support for the Visionary Organizations
description: - Multipage study compares: 4GL/5GL, 3GL (Ada 95, C, C++, COBOL, FORTRAN, Java, Smalltalk), 2GL (Assembly). Divides language (definition) from traits of products that implement and support it. Several sections, tables, appendixes.

name: A Course in Python/CGI
description: - This site contains materials from a 13 week course for learning Python and CGI. Suited for self-study.

name: A Quick Tour of Python
description: - Short overview of some basics, for users with some programming knowledge.

name: About.com: Python
description: - Includes articles on simple script solutions, database management, web development, network protocols, and other advanced topics.

name: Chicago Python User Group
description: - Meetings, book reviews and mailing list.

name: Clepy
description: - A group of Python enthusiasts living in the Cleveland, Ohio, area.

name: Dallas Ft. Worth Pythoneers
description: - Offers mailing list, a source repository and member profiles.

name: HOPL: An Interactive Roster of Programming Languages
description: - History of Programming Languages encyclopedia, over 8,500 languages, full verified references, code samples, big bibliography, biographical-institutional material, 4,000 language family tree.

name: History and Comparison of Programming Languages
description: - Files compare statements in several different languages, tracing from early to present languages.

name: Io Comparisons
description: - Compares a few variables (size, speed, syntax) in many languages: Brain, C, Cel, F-Script, Forth (gForth, pForth), Icon, Java (Kaffe), Lisp (CLisp, Guile, LispMe, Scheme48), Lua, Perl, Pike, Python, Ruby, Self, Smalltalk (GNU, Squeak, SuperCollider), Tcl.

name: Java and C++ Resource Management Comparison
description:
- Detailed discussion of the techniques used in Java and C++ to implement leak free and exception safe resource management. Covers memory management, finalizers, destructors and finally blocks with examples.
                     [PDF]

name: An Introduction to Tkinter
description: - By Fredrik Lundh. Official tutorial for Tkinter, standard Python interface to Tk GUI toolkit; widget configuration, styling; function/method bindings to widget events; documents all Tkinter widgets, classes. Formats: PDF, HTML.

name: Cameron Laird on Python and the Web
description: - Discusses both client-side and server-side Web programming.

name: Code Like a Pythonista: Idiomatic Python
description: - A tutorial that teaches common Python programming idioms used by experienced programmers, but may not be obvious to newcomers.

name: FRPythoneers
description: - A Python user group in the Fort Collins area that meets in Broomfield, CO.

name: Fredericksburg ZPUG
description: - Fredericksburg Zope and Python Users Group.

name: Java vs. C#
description: - Code for code comparison. All features on both languages are compared.

name: Languages Versus D
description: - Growing table compares D, C, C++, C#, Java, Delphi, Python, Perl, Eiffel, Sather, Smalltalk, Lisp/CLOS, Ada. Many clarifying comments below. [Wiki4D, Open Content]

name: Lisp as an Alternative to Java
description: - Brief text on comparisons of C, C++, Java, Lisp, Ron Garret / Erann Gat study, with conforming example program Lisp source code; very useful links.

name: Lisp as an Alternative to Java
description:
- Ron Garret / Erann Gat comparison, starts from 1999 Prechelt study results, adds many insights; as text, a few tables. [Intelligence]
                     [PDF]

name: Multi-Core Ant Colony Optimization for TSP in Erlang
description: - Compares Erlang, GHC Haskell, Standard ML (Alice, MLton); text, tables, graphs.

name: Five Minutes to a Python CGI
description: - By David Mertz. Brief introduction to writing CGI programs, Python CGI module, formatting output, error logging/debugging.

name: OPAG
description: - Ottawa Python Authors Group. A group devoted to learning, using and providing resources for Python. OPAG also serves as a general gathering place for Python programmers from the Ottawa region and beyond.

name: Omaha Python Users Group
description: - A Python users group in the Omaha, NE Metro area.

name: Philadelphia Python Users Group
description: - New user group for the Philadelphia Area.

name: ExpectPy
description: - An extension for a Python-feel to the Expect library. [Open Source, LGPL]

name: Orbtech
description: - They offer Python programming expertise and are specialized in Python training, consulting and custom software development.

name: Pythonware
description: - Developers of the PythonWorks IDE,  and useful modules such as the Python Imaging Library and  XML-RPC implementation.

name: ReportLab
description: - Authors of PDFgen, for generating professionally formatted printable documents on the fly.

name: Vorras
description: - A software development and consulting firm specializing in developing  internet messaging applications using Python.

name: Nine Language Performance Round-up: Benchmarking Math & File I/O
description: - Small-scale benchmark test run on 9 languages or variants: Java 1.3.1 and 1.4.2, C via gcc 3.3.1, Python 2.3.2 and via Psyco 1.1.1, 4 from Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003: Visual Basic/C#/C++/J#.

name: PLEAC: Programming Language Examples Alike Cookbook
description: - Suite of common programming problems solved in Ada, C++, Erlang, Guile, Haskell, Java, Masd, merd, NASM, Objective Caml, Perl, Pliant, Python, Ruby, Tcl.

name: Instant Hacking
description: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal, concise, general introduction to programming, via Python, moves very quickly. English, Italian, Polish, Japanese, Serbian, Korean.

name: Instant Python
description: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal introduction for experienced programmers. Treats basics, OO programming, Jedi mind trick. English, French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish; German, Norwegian; Lithuanian, Polish, Russian; Japanese, Korean.

name: JPython: The Felicitous Union of Python and Java
description: - Excerpt from O'Reilly book: Learning Python.

name: PyGTA
description: - The Toronto Python/Zope User Group meets regularly to explore the expanding world of Python and Zope.

name: The GrimPypers
description: - A group of Python users, programmers and enthusiasts based in Grimstad, Norway.

name: Grouch
description: - Web development related open source software packages developed by MEMS and Nanotechnology Exchange. [Open Source, Python license]

name: Orange
description: - A free, component-based, public domain data mining software, which includes a range of preprocessing, modelling and data exploration techniques. [Open Source, GPL]

name: Parallel Python
description: - Provides an open source module to allow parallel execution of code on systems with multiple processors and on clusters. Features list, documentation, download, code samples, and a discussion forum.

name: Xellsoft
description: - Specialize in Python programming technology and object oriented databases, develop custom software and offer consulting in the area of internet, data communication, technical and scientific programming.

name: bridgekeeper
description: - A Perl to Python source code conversion service.

name: decompyle
description: - A service to decompile Python bytecode to readable Python source files.

name: Perl vs. Python vs. Ruby
description: - Comparison with text, code samples, many reader comments. Michael Tsai weblog.

name: Programming Information from HB
description: - Text descriptions compare C/C++, Java, Pascal, Basic, VeraStream; Oracle; HTML, XML; JavaScript, PHP.

name: Programming Language Benchmarks
description: - Compares the same program in Ada, C, Forth, FORTRAN, Java, Lisp, Perl, R, Ruby. Goal: support decisions in language choice for making compute-intensive Web programs. Text, table, code samples.

name: Programming Language Categories
description: - Brief text compares 6 basic language types: general scripting, programmer scripting, application development, low-level, pure functional, complete core.

name: Learning Python
description: - By Mark Lutz, David Ascher. Samples from O'Reilly book. Has manipulating data structures, files, programs; internet programming; JPython, now Jython, Python implementation for the Java platform.

name: One Day of IDLE Toying
description: - By Danny Yoo. Visual guide to using IDLE, a simple interactive shell for Python programming. Each step of this tutorial has screenshots for absolute beginners. English, Dutch, German; Greek, French, Italian, Portuguese; Indonesian.

name: Programming Python, 2nd Edition
description: - By Mark Lutz. O'Reilly book sample. Introduces Internet related topics: Zope (web publishing framework), HTMLgen (makes web pages from objects), Jython (Python for Java), XML processing, server pages, Windows web scripting extensions, restricted execution mode tools.

name: TriZPUG
description: - he Triangle Zope/Python User Group in the Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill area of North Carolina, USA.

name: Utah Python User Group
description: - Offers meeting information, mailing list and links to members' blogs.

name: Sisyphus
description: - A module that simplifies running Python stuff as cron jobs. [Open Source, Python license]

name: The Snack Sound Toolkit
description: - Module for basic sound handling (sound card and disk I/O); includes primitives for sound visualization, e.g. waveforms and spectrograms. [Open Source, GPL]

name: config
description: - Module allows implement a hierarchical configuration scheme for Python applications.

name: Programming Language Comparison
description: - Table and text compares many features of some popular object-oriented languages: C++, C#, Eiffel, Java, Perl, Python, Ruby, Smalltalk, Visual Basic.

name: Programming Languages Mini-howto
description: - Briefly compares major Linux programming languages: C, C++, Fortran, Java, Lisp, Perl, PHP, Python, Tcl; by Risto S. Varanka.

name: Python Babysteps Tutorial
description: - Preliminary tutorial, prepares absolute beginners for other tutorials. Walks reader through installing on Windows, using Integrated DeveLopment Environment (IDLE), writing a simple program.

name: Python Database Programming
description: - Programs can use minimal code to access, display, and update a database.  This guide provides "links to relevant Python modules, documentation, and projects" concerning databases, as well as adding persistence to Python objects.

name: boston-pig
description: - The Boston Python Interest Group will be meeting in Boston, MA.

name: log4p
description: - The Logging Toolkit For Python, modeled after the Java toolkit log4j. [Open Source, IBM Public License]

name: mxBase package extensions for Python
description: - The eGenix.com mx Extensions for Python are a collection of professional quality Python software tools which enhance Python's usability in many important areas such as ODBC database connectivity, fast text processing, date/time processing and web site programming.

name: pytables
description: - A hierarchical database package designed to efficiently manage very large amounts of data. [Open Source, BSD]

name: Programming Languages Study
description: - Includes: diagram, history of languages; history of language concepts; syntax across languages; Scriptometer measures scripting ease of languages; mutability and sharing of various values in various languages.

name: Python Compared to Other Languages
description: - Many links to comparisons involving Python.

name: Qtime Collection, FTP Download, Gzipped
description: - Display time as English sentence, coded in: AWK, C, ICI, Icon, JavaScript, Lite/mSQL, PHP3, Pike, Python, REBOL, Rexx, Ruby, SLang, Spanner. Tested on only Linux (all) and AmigaOS (C and Rexx versions).

name: Ray Tracer Language Comparison
description: - Mini ray tracer benchmark written equivalently in C++, Java, SML, Objective Caml, Lisp, Scheme. Compares verbosity, performance; text, code samples, tables, image, graph. [Flying Frog Consultancy]

name: Reasons for TOM
description: - TOM attempts to address flaws in these languages: C++, Cecil, Common Lisp, Eiffel, Java, Objective-C, Smalltalk.

name: Ruby Versus Nine Object-Oriented Languages
description: - Compares Ruby, Objective-C, Smalltalk-80, C++, Java, Python, CLOS, Perl5, PHP, Dylan.

name: Python HOWTO Documents
description: - Pointers to various helpful Python-related HOWTO documents.

name: Python Idioms and Efficiency
description: - A guide to Python programming idioms, and suggestions for writing more elegant Python programs.

name: Python Library Reference Search
description: - Online. Also the search can be downloaded for mirroring and off-line use.

name: txObject ATK
description: - Contains the following parts: Object Library, IO/Timers, Threads, Inter-Process/Distributed Communication. [Open Source, GPL]

name: An Introduction to Programming Languages
description: - A neutral conceptual analysis for those who know one language and want to learn about others.

name: Lambda the Ultimate
description: - Programming Languages Weblog with news and discussion.

name: Programming Language
description: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

name: Webopedia: Programming Languages
description: - Dictionary definitions for words in this category.

name: Simple Programs in Various Different Programming Languages
description: - Common algorithms and other sample code in the languages: Bash and Bourne shells, C/C++, Java, MATLAB/Octave, Perl, Python, Ruby, Scheme.

name: Syntax Across Languages
description: - Operator names and syntax elements in various programming languages.

name: TIOBE Programming Community Index: TPCI
description: - Updated monthly. Shows language popularity via world-wide availability of skilled engineers, courses, 3rd party vendors. Calculated from search engines Google, MSN, Yahoo.

name: TMXxine Languages
description: - Brief comparison Curl with High Level assembler, BCX, Dark Basic, Mono (C#/.Net implementation), Python, Squeak, XBasic/XBlite. Curl applet examples.

name: Python Programming Tutorial
description: - By Richard G. Baldwin. Separate lessons teach programming basics. Free online, fee download files.

name: Python Programming for Beginners
description: - Shows how to write programs that use command-line options, read and write to pipes, access environment variables, handle interrupts, read from and write to files, create temporary files, write to system logs.

name: Python Quick Reference
description: - By Simon Brunning. Thorough 'cheat sheet'; brief reminders for nearly each language aspect: syntax nuances; built-in features, statements, modules; basic, advanced types, operations; lexical entities, common development tools. For several Python versions; HTML, Zip, Windows Help, text.

name: Team Eiffel: The Zen of Python, Part I
description: - Text compares Python and Eiffel, via Tim Peters' Zen rules.

name: The BNF Web Club Language
description: - Browse, explore some programming language syntax rules, see relations between rules, understand them via BNF (Backus-Naur Form notation) and syntactic diagrams: SQL, PL/SQL, SQL2, IDL; Ada 95, Java, Modula-2; Lazy, Lisp, M5.

name: The Case against C
description: - Five short essays compare C (and C++ by extension) to Fortran: Why C is Not a Good Numerical Language, Why C is Not a Good First Language, C's Poor Loop Constructs, C's Pointers and Optimisation, Optimisation through Directives.

name: The Computer Language Benchmarks Game
description: - Performance measurements and source code for ~12 benchmark programs in ~30 languages; with side-by-side comparisons between any 2 programming language implementations, and interactive boxplot chart comparisons between any 15.

name: The Quine Page
description: - Collection of self-reproducing programs: each outputs a copy of its own source code; about 60 languages.

name: The ROT13 Page
description: - ROT13 implemented in many programming languages.

name: Python Recipes
description: - Collaborative website built by ActiveState and O'Reilly, hosts user contributions; collection of recipes.

name: The Zen of Python
description: - Compares traits of many languages, without naming any; by Tim Peters.

name: Timing Trials, or, the Trials of Timing: Experiments with Scripting and User-Interface Languages
description: - By Brian Kernighan, Christopher Van Wyk. Compares how fast C, Awk, Perl, Tcl, Java, Visual Basic, Limbo, Scheme, run a range of representative tasks. Text, tables, graphs, code samples.

name: University of Michigan's Language Guide
description: - Each entry includes history, description, code examples, and references.

name: What Languages Fix
description: - Compares many languages in brief text, describes each by the problem it fixes. [Paul Graham]

name: What's Wrong with Perl
description: - Author explains what he considers wrong about Perl, presents Python as an alternative. Descriptions, code samples, links.

name: Python SIGs
description: - Archives of current and past listserv discussions on a LOT of interesting topics. GREAT for researching problems.

name: Python Tutorial
description: - Introduction to Python, where to find it, how to install, and create a very simple script.

name: Why Pascal is Not My Favorite Programming Language
description: - Brian Kernighan's comparison of Pascal and C

name: Why to Move from ASM to C
description: - Brief text compares Assembly to C; lower to higher level language. ScienceProg.

name: Java vs Ruby: A Comparison of the Key Elements
description:
- Compares building blocks of two languages, in text and code samples. Developer.com.
                     (December 13, 2007)

name: Seven Reasons I Switched Back to PHP after Two Years on Rails
description:
- Derek Sivers spent two years trying to make Rails do something it wasn't meant to do, then realized his old abandoned language (PHP) would do just fine if approached with my new Rails-gained wisdom.
                     (September 22, 2007)

name: Python and UML
description: - Can the UML help Python developers? How about CP4E?

name: Python for Beginners
description: - New to programming? This page lists some places that can get you started quickly.

name: Haskell and Scheme: Which One and Why?
description:
- Text comparison. ScienceBlogs LLC; Good Math, Bad Math.
                     (October 24, 2006)

name: Comparing PHP with Other Languages
description:
- Text compares several traits of ASP.NET, C#, PHP, Java, Lisp, Perl, Python, Ruby, Smalltalk. Article with forum posts. [Professional PHP]
                     (February 09, 2006)

name: ASP vs. PHP
description:
- Brief text compares website building languages ASP, PHP on several points. [WebProNews]
                     (December 22, 2005)

name: TCC Publications: Programming Languages
description: - Python language quick reference (28 pp),  Tkinter reference (84 pp),  Python Imaging Library PIL quick reference (6 pp). Postscript and PDF formats available.

name: Schizoid Classes: Of Class, Type, and Method
description:
- Compares Java and Smalltalk, in text and table. By Rodney Bates. [ACM Queue]
                     (September 01, 2004)

name: Tutorialized.com - Free Python tutorials
description: - A collection of Python tutorials from resources around the Internet.

name: Wikibooks Programming Python
description: - A tutorial for python on Wikibooks. It is editable by anyone.

name: Writing CGI Programs in Python
description: - Introduces using Python for CGI applications. Has database access examples. Several parts. [Developer Shed]

name: What I Hate About Your Programming Language
description:
- Text treats general aspects of language choices, then compares hatred of Perl, Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, C, C++, JavaScript, XSLT, SQL. With many forum comments. [ONLamp.com]
                     (May 12, 2003)

name: Are Scripting Languages the Wave of the Future?
description:
- Programming guru, Robert Martin, on languages of the coming decade. [ITworld.com]
                     (March 01, 2001)

name: C#: A Language Alternative or Just J--?, Part 1
description:
- Compares C# to Java, describes features and design trade-offs, places C# in context of broader Microsoft .Net strategy. Text, tables, code samples, links. By Mark Johnson. First article of 2-part series. [JavaWorld]
                     (November 01, 2000)

name: C# Strikes a Chord
description:
- Compares 4 languages: C, C++, C#, Java. Shows family genealogy. [Dr. Dobb's Journal]
                     (September 04, 2000)

name: The C Family of Languages
description:
- Interview with Dennis Ritchie, Bjarne Stroustrup, James Gosling.
                     (July 01, 2000)

name: An Empirical Comparison of C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Rexx, and Tcl
description:
- By Lutz Prechelt. Neutral, quantitative analysis of 7 languages in title, for 7 variables, via 80 implementations of the same requirement set. PDF format. [IEEE Computer]
                     [PDF] (March 14, 2000)

name: Gnat and Linux: C++ and Java Under Fire
description:
- Compares Ada, Java, C, C++, Delphi. Text, tables. Gnat and Linux orientation. [Linux Gazette]
                     (October 01, 1998)

name: Programming Language Critiques: Pascal, C, C++, and C-Linda
description:
- Text compares languages on many points; by Jim Basney.
                     (May 01, 1995)

name: Hap Python Remote Debugger
description: - A remote debugger and IDE that can also be used for local debugging.

name: IPython
description: - An enhanced interactive Python shell with many features for object introspection, system shell access, and its own special command system for adding functionality when working interactively. [Open Source, LGPL]

name: PyCrust - The Flakiest Python Shell
description: - An interactive, graphical Python shell written in Python using wxPython.

name: PyReverse
description: - A set of tools for reverse engineering Python code, including creation of files readable by ArgoUML. Project information, downloads, and bug-track details. [Open Source, GPL]

name: Pymerase
description: - A tool intended to generate a python object model, relational database, and an object-relational model connecting the two using UML or XML. However, it has been extended to also output GUI widgets and can be easily extended to output whatever else you might like. [Open source, MIT License]

name: Tixapps Applications Framework
description: - Tixapps applications are a suite of development applications that run with  Tk/Tcl or Python, using the Tix widget set. [Open Source, BSD-like]

name: Winpdb
description: - An advanced python debugger, with support for smart breakpoints, multiple threads, namespace modification, embedded debugging and encrypted communication.

name: Ace Scripting Language
description: - High-performance, strongly typed language, support for SGML and XML document standards, part of Structured Information Manager (SIM) product range. Free Download.

name: Blaise
description: - An object-oriented scripting language with Object Pascal-like syntax. [Open source, MPL]

name: C-SMILE
description: - Scripting language, syntax and structure from C, C++, Java, JavaScript. In classification, resides between Java and JavaScript. Has compiler, virtual machine running bytecodes, C/C++ extensible runtime. Runs standalone or embedded. [Public Domain]

name: Expect
description: - Scripting language related to Tcl, for controlling interactive processes. [Public Domain]

name: Scriptol Compiler
description: - Object- and XML-oriented, procedural language; goals: natural, safe, powerful, make programming fast and pleasant; code compiles to PHP or C++, source code or binary. English, Français. Open source, Mozilla license.

name: Scriptol Interpreter
description: - Description, examples, FAQ, CD, resources, translations, links.  Open source, BSD license. [English, French]

name: Squirrel
description: - A high level imperative/OO programming language, designed to be a scripting tool that fits in the size, memory bandwidth, and real-time requirements of applications like games. [Open source, zlib/libpng licence]

name: Boo
description: - New object-oriented statically typed language for Common Language Infrastructure (.NET, Mono), Python inspired syntax, focus on language and compiler extensibility.

name: CPython
description: - The original implementation of Python, written in C.

name: IronPython
description: - A fast Python implementation for .NET and Mono.

name: Jython
description: - A 100 % Pure Java implementation of the Python language.

name: PyPy
description: - Development of a highly flexible Python implementation.

name: Python for .NET
description: - Package gives nearly seamless integration with .NET Common Language Runtime: CLR. Strong scripting tool, allows scripting or building full programs in Python, using .NET services and components coded in any language targeting CLR: Managed C++, C#, VB, JScript.

name: Stackless Python
description: - An experimental implementation that supports continuations, generators, microthreads, and coroutines.
